title: Final: Alabama tops Arkansas 27-14 - AL.com
text:
Comments 
Alabama looks to keep the positive momentum rolling as it takes on Arkansas at Bryant-Denny Stadium. 
No. 8 Alabama (4-1) enters the game as a 16 1/2-point favorite over Arkansas. Last week, Alabama defeated Georgia 38-10 and Arkansas got its first Southeastern Conference win over Tennessee, 24-20. Alabama has won the last eight meetings between the two teams. 
Kickoff is expected at 6:00 p.m. CT and the game will be televised on ESPN. 
Follow along for live updates and analysis all game long: 
FINAL: 
-- Alabama runs out the clock to seal a 27-14 win over the Hogs, the Tide's 9th-straight victory over Arkansas. It wasn't pretty but Alabama finished the game strong. Nick Saban will likely have plenty of notes for his team before next week's showdown with Texas A&M. 
FOURTH QUARTER: 
--Allen hits Dominique Reed for a 54-yard touchdown to cut lead to 27-14. 
--Derrick Henry gets his touchdown after a hard day's work. He's up to 95 yards on 27 carries. 
--Stop me if you've heard this one before: The Alabama defense got it done again. 
--Adam Griffith hits a 35-yard field goal to put Tide up 20-7. He is now 1 of 3 on the day. 
--Eddie Jackson INT gives Alabama the ball back on Arkansas' 13-yard line. 
--Coker finds Mullaney for a 3-yard touchdown to give Alabama a 17-7 lead. That touchdown was huge and a direct result of Arkansas' botched fake punt. 
--Alabama opens the quarter on Arkansas' 42-yard line. 
THIRD QUARTER: Alabama 10, Arkansas 7 
--Arkansas goes for a fake punt, but Alabama sniffs it out. Tide takes over at 44-yard line. 
--Coker connects with Calvin Ridley for a 81-yard touchdown to give Alabama a 10-7 lead. 
--Dominique Reed with a big fan on 3rd and 15 to give Arkansas the first down. Tide D can't get off the field. 
--Alabama is forced to punt again. The good news is the old J.K. Scott is back and pushes Arkansas back to 20-yard line. 
--Kenyan Drake makes a big play at an important time to get Alabama a first down. 
--Alabama gets the ball back on 16-yard line. A long offensive drive here would help a defense doing all it can in this one. 
--Reggie Ragland hits Brandon Allen and strips the ball but the ball bounces out of bounds for an Arkansas first down. 
--Alabama offense can't do anything on that drive. Putting a lot of pressure on defense to keep them in the game. 
--Alabama defense getting the job done. But can the offense put up points? Coker looks off tonight. 
--Call is later overturned after replay showed Arkansas player touched the ball. Arkansas will get the ball on its 22-yd line. 
--Alabama's drive continues after a roughing the punter penalty following a Scott punt. 
--Alabama will start with the ball after deferring earlier. 
SECOND QUARTER: Arkansas 7, Alabama 3 
-- Griffith misses a 48-yard field goal and Alabama enters halftime down 7-3. 
-- Alabama with a little drive going here. Has the ball on Arkansas' 39-yard line with 12 seconds remaining. 
-- Jake Coker INT gives Arkansas the ball deep in Alabama's territory. Arkansas capitalizes on a 4-yard touchdown pass to Drew Morgan. Razorbacks up 7-3 with 1:29 remaining in the first half. 
-- Massive Reuben Foster hit on Brandon Allen forces Arkansas to punt again. 
-- Another three-and-out for Arkansas. Bama D getting it done tonight. 
-- Jake Coker throws an interception after a long throw intended for O.J. Howard is thrown into double coverage. 
-- Rashaan Evans sacks Brandon Allen to end another Arkansas drive. Razorbacks forced to punt again. 
-- Reggie Ragland banged up on a play, but is able to run off the field on his own power. 
-- Alabama can't punch it in from close again. Adam Griffith misses the 25-yard field goal. Alabama is dominating yardage and time of possession, but hasn't truly capitalized on two redzone opportunities. 
-- Alabama will start second quarter on Arkansas' 5-yard line. 
FIRST QUARTER: Alabama 3, Arkansas 0 
--Alabama with a nice drive going right now. Thus far it's 7-plays, 41-yards and the Tide has the ball on Arkansas' 32-yard line. 
--Alabama forces a three-and-out. Arkansas QB Brandon Allen took a shot from Reggie Ragland on that throw. 
--Adam Griffith nails a field goal from 24-yards out to give Alabama 3-0 lead. It capped off a 13-play, 80-yard drive. 
--ArDarius Stewart with a 37-yard gain for the Tide after a screen pass from Coker. Puts the Tide deep inside Arkansas territory. 
--Alabama gets the ball on its own 13-yard line and Jake Coker hits Calvin Ridley for a six-yard gain on the Tide's first offensive play. 
--Tide gives up a 15-yard gain on the game's opening play, but holds Arkansas at the 44-yard line to force a punt. 
--Arkansas will start at its own 25-yard line. 
PREGAME 
--Alabama wins the toss and defers to the second half. Arkansas will get the ball to start. 
--Looks like kickoff should be a little after 6:05 p.m. 
Cyrus Jones, Jarran Reed and O.J. Howard are the team captains against Arkansas.
